H0.text: Who, as the first chairman of the British Rail Board, infamously directed the huge reduction in railway lines across the UK in the 1960s. Ernest Marples

H1.text: Who, as the first chairman of the British Rail Board, infamously directed the huge reduction in railway lines across the UK in the 1960s. Richard Beeching

H2.text: Who, as the first chairman of the British Rail Board, infamously directed the huge reduction in railway lines across the UK in the 1960s. Barbara Castle

H3.text: Who, as the first chairman of the British Rail Board, infamously directed the huge reduction in railway lines across the UK in the 1960s. Dr beaching

A4.text: Beeching was the first chairman of the British Railways Board

A5.text: As a result of the report, just over 4,000 route miles (12,100 km) of railway throughout Britain, only 3,000 miles (4,800 km) 'should be selected for future development' and invested in
